medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive vision loss in both eyes, recurrent systemic infections, and recurrent mononeuropathy over 2 years.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in mid 2012 with 6/6 visual acuity in the right eye and 6/18 in the left eye, showing no improvement over time. Symptoms progressed with increasing visual impairment, recurrent abscesses, and mononeuropathy episodes. By November 2014, visual acuity was reduced to hand movements at 1 m, and the patient was lethargic with significant ocular changes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anaphylaxis to peanuts, allergy to dairy products, and a history of recurrent infections and Bell's palsies.
medical_history.social_history: Patient followed an anxiety-driven diet consisting solely of white bread and French fries due to allergies.
